ch.unifr.pai.twice.layout.client.eclipseLayout
Class MiceLayoutTabPanel.NewAreaDropHandler

java.lang.Object
  ch.unifr.pai.twice.layout.client.eclipseLayout.MiceLayoutTabPanel.NewAreaDropHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
ch.unifr.pai.twice.dragndrop.client.intf.DropTargetHandler
Enclosing class:
MiceLayoutTabPanel
private static class MiceLayoutTabPanel.NewAreaDropHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ch.unifr.pai.twice.dragndrop.client.intf.DropTargetHandler

The drop handler which handles drops of MiceTabLabels on the borders of existing MiceLayoutTabPanels.

Author:
Oliver Schmid

Constructor Detail

MiceLayoutTabPanel.NewAreaDropHandler

public MiceLayoutTabPanel.NewAreaDropHandler(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.DockLayoutPanel.Direction direction,
                                             com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.FocusPanel focusPanel,
                                             MiceLayoutTabPanel tabPanel)
Parameters:
direction - - the direction of the new area handler (relative to the parent layout MiceLayoutTabPanel)
focusPanel - - the widget whose drag events actually represent the drop area (these are widgets which are attached at the different borders of the MiceLayoutTabPanel).
tabPanel - - the tab panel, the dragged tab originates from

onDrop

public boolean onDrop(java.lang.String deviceId,
                      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget widget,
                      com.google.gwt.dom.client.Element dragProxy,
                      com.google.gwt.user.client.Event event,
                      java.lang.Double intersectionPercentage,
                      java.lang.Double intersectionPercentageWithTarget)
The actual drop handler. It only accepts drops of MiceTabLabels and handles the creation of a new MiceSplitLayoutPanel to which the dropped widget is attached to.

Specified by:
